Key Match Events: Jaker Ali was caught by Aiden Markram on the straight boundary trying to hit the six that would win it for Bangladesh
Mahmudullah couldn't believe it, and stood his ground a while, waiting for a review that never came
Taskin Ahmed needed to hit the last ball for six to win. He couldn’t.
Bangladesh deserved better, especially Towhid Hridoy, who had held everything together with his fine 37
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh played one of the better games any team have turned in at the Nassau County ground
It was the second-biggest crowd they have had here during the tournament, a little smaller than India’s, but just as loud
Post-Match Reflections: They were chasing only 113. South Africa’s innings was a wreck
In this tournament South Africa, who have a reputation for losing games they ought to win, seem to be winning all the ones they ought to lose
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh caught out at the last as South Africa win by four runs
Bangladesh had already been robbed of four leg byes that had ricocheted away off Mahmudullah's pads
The umpires have him out lbw. He overturned it on review, but the runs had already been struck off
Others: Bangladesh's batters managed the chase brilliantly until the final over
South Africa's rotation was like a stopped clock
Bangladesh had brought Tanzim Hasan Sakib to bolster their fast bowling
